item.title: About
item.description:
I’m from Aotearoa (New Zealand), was born on the Heretaunga Plains, and grew up on the hills of Te Mata Peak. I’m a first generation kiwi – my mother came here from Scotland as a Teacher, my father from England as a Mainframe Engineer , they met sky-diving. I live in Pōneke (Wellington) with my partner Alanna, and two rascal children. My name is Mix.

ℹ️ Introductions in NZ are context-first – the “individual” is better understood by where they stand, and who they relate to.

I’m a nerd – I love sci-fi, magic the gathering, programming, ecosystem tuning. I love people and community, so I’ve spent most of my adult life in groups of nerds gardening community – teaching, writing code that serves people, weaving chat groups, and hosting picnics.

Double Edged Swords ⚔️

I think many of the things which distinguish us from one another are strengths in some contexts and weaknesses in others. Understanding these helps us know in what environments we will thrive, where we might need support, and who we might work really effectively with

Precision

I tend to load a lot of detail in when trying to understand something. If I’m making some discernment/ judgement, I want to understand the veracity, the context, the relationships. Glossing over detail feels wrong to me. I’d rather defer – keeping possibility space open – than jumping to wrong conclusion.

Positives 👍

  • very thorough reader
  • spots edge cases in systems (quirks which lead to unintended consequences)
  • asks incisive questions
  • understands deeply
  • forebearant (not quick to judge)

Negatives 👎

  • slow reader
  • analysis paralysis (load more context than is needed)
  • mistaken for critic/ pedant (deep understanding == care though!)
  • stickler for words
  • slow to label bad actors

Sensitivity

Sensory input (particularly aural, visual) that is out of place or unusual stand out a lot to me. I don’t think I have super-powered sense organs, rather my sense processing is tuned a little different than others.

Positives 👍

  • spots errors
  • matter-out-of-place memory → quick at finding
  • finds broken things (electronics, pipes, machinery)
  • hears upset children/ stuck animals
  • can rock-hop at speed

Negatives 👎

  • odd sounds pull my attention like a fox (out of conversation)
  • struggle to parse voices in crowded / reverberant environments
  • annoyed by dying fluorescent tubes
  • disturbed by tree pruning / removal

Long-game

When I find something I love in the world, or something that has potential for greatness, I often ask myself “how could more people benefit from this?” or “what would further enhance this?”. I’m thinking in the long term, about scaling the pattern I see, and ensuring it’s accessibility and longevity.

Positives 👍

  • sees potentials
  • amazing first-follower / cheerleader / support character
  • active bridger and weaver of people
  • unperturbed by short-term social costs
    • loves constructive feedback
    • asks questions so minorities don’t have to
    • breaks ice

Negatives 👎

  • jumps too far ahead
  • chronic feedback (it can be very hard for me to not share important data)

🚧 – more to write here

Second Opinion 🧑‍🤝‍🧑

You shouldn’t necessarily trust people’s narratives about themselves. Here’s what some friends say about me. If you think there are things missing, get in touch and I’ll update <3

Chelsea Robinson
Notices the little things and helps people with their little things with unstoppable generosity to make their life better.
Andre Staltz
Had a ton of creative ideas, wrote new software to explore those ideas (either UI or backend modules), as well as documentation and specifications. But I want to specifically highlight his people skills. I can easily say that Mix was the heart of Scuttlebutt - he welcomed and cared for every newcomer, was a mediator in discussions, proactively connected people outside with people inside, and fostered collaboration across projects.
Gina Rembe
Always on the lookout for energy-optimisation in the best possible way.
Silvia Zuur
A kindred curiosity spirit. Asking questions, and enquiring. Often about stuff I have no clue about, but with a deep interest that I respect.
Ben Tairea
An amazing developer, a great coordinator and communicator, and a good friend. I've had the privilege of working with Mix for the past 6 years building complex systems, bridging the gap between culture and technology. He has helped shape not only the technology we built, but also the type of organisation we wanted be.
Luandro Vieira
Mix knows how to unlock more than just encrypted systems, he unlocks potential in people. With the mind of an engineer and the heart of a community gardener, he never enters alone. He brings others with him, opening paths that change lives. Mine was one of them.

Work ⚖️

Status – I’m currently available for work!

My specialisations include:

  • Data-sovereignty, digital identity, peer-2-peer networks
  • Bridging the technical with Community/ Org
  • Collective leadership, co-operative organising

I love working on systems that serve humanity ❤️ I work with excellent humans, teams which know how to collaborate, orgs with great leadership.

❤️‍🔥 Projects – things I’m proud to have contributed to
💼 CV – a record of my skills & employment

Contact 📝

You can contact me at hello@mixmix.nz
Prefer to Signal if we’re connected.

item.title: CV
item.description:
I work on growing systems which help people, ideally communities or society. I’ve practised this across many domains and wield tools from education, social-enterprise, startups, open-source software, parenting. I prioritise working with excellent humans.

This page maps raw activities and skills deployed. Check out my About page and posts for a broader picture.

Entity Role Skills
University of Otago Student (BSc. Hons. Maths) Mathematics, Physics, Biology, Neuroscience,
Tutoring
Research Assistant Literature Review, Blood Splatter Modeling
Student (Post Grad. Dip. Teaching) Pedagogy, Acting, Crowd-control
Unlimited Paenga Tawhiti Teacher Customised Learning, Mentoring, Pastoral Care,
Bitcoin-trading, Lock-picking
Entity Role Skills
Unlimited Paenga Tawhiti Teacher (see above)
Enspiral Dev Academy Teacher, * NodeJS, SQL, React, Redux, OAuth, Express,
Curriculum Design, Hiring, Mentoring, …
Victoria University Student (Fine Art) Parametric Design, Python,
Critical Theory
Loomio Owner, Programmer Ruby, Javascript, i18n
Facilitation, Retrospectives, Scrum Master,
Translation Coordination
Cobudget Programmer Ruby, Javascript, i18n
POC21 Support Team System Tuner, Facilitator
Scuttlebutt Programmer, Community Gardener, Leader NodeJS, GraphQL, React/ Vue, Distributed Ledgers, P2P, CRDT, Technical Specification, Cryptography, Architecture, UX + UI,
Strategy, Facilitation, Grant Management, Community Growth, …
Protozoa Owner Business Process, Radical Income Sharing, DEI work, Facilitation

Āhau CTO, Programmer Strategy, System Architecture, NodeJS, Vue, GraphQL, Group Encryption, CRDT, Technical Specification, UX + UI, Facilitation, Mentoring, Community support, …

Scuttlebutt Programmer, Community Gardener, Leader NodeJS, GraphQL, React/ Vue, Distributed Ledgers, P2P, CRDT, Technical Specification, Cryptography, Architecture, UX + UI,
Strategy, Facilitation, Grant Management, Community Growth, …
Protozoa Founder/ Owner Business Process, Radical Income Sharing, DEI work, Facilitation
Āhau CTO, Programmer Strategy, System Architecture, NodeJS, Vue, GraphQL, Group Encryption, CRDT, Technical Specification, UX + UI, Facilitation, Mentoring, Community support, …

Mātou Founder/ Owner, CTO, Programmer Strategy, Operations, Fundraising, Project Lead,
NodeJS, Typescripts, Verifiable Credentials (Identus)
Decent Social Founder, Host Event Design, Regional Hosting, Code of Conduct
Beautiful Signals Organiser, Host, Programmer Swarming, Facillitation, Workshop hosting
Hugo, Github Actions
